intro: Touchiroa senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese touchiroa, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in dune environments. The leaves are broad and palmately lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
